byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn contributed reporting from Moscow, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.

abstract: Spokesman for Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin denies there was ever any agreement to free Ukrainian helicopter pilot Nadiya V Savchenko, even as State Department insists Russia agreed to her release as part of Minsk negotiations to free all war prisoners.
lead_paragraph: A spokesman for President Vladimir V. Putin said the pilot, Nadiya V. Savchenko, was not covered by accords negotiated by Russia and Ukraine this week.

headline.main: Ukraine Says Putin Agreed to Free Pilot; He Denies It
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Says Putin Agreed to Free Pilot; He Denies It

snippet: A spokesman for President Vladimir V. Putin said the pilot, Nadiya V. Savchenko, was not covered by accords negotiated by Russia and Ukraine this week.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
